column3: Please see the travis output, there are missing files.

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16267](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16267.html) (bench: Benchmark blockToJSON by fanatid)
*

Not sure how to fix msvc build:
```
c:\projects itcoin\src ench\data lock413567.raw.h(1): error C2373: 'benchmark::data::block413567': redefinition; different type modifiers [C:\projects itcoin uild_msvc ench_bitcoin ench_bitcoin.vcxproj]
```

The windows build just fails without any error message:

```
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\Common7\IDE\VC\VCTargets\Microsoft.CppCommon.targets(423,5): error MSB6006: "clcache.exe" exited with code 1. [C:\projects itcoin uild_msvc ench_bitcoin ench_bitcoin.vcxproj]
```

@sipsorcery Any ideas?

@MarcoFalke the almost 1 million byte vector initialiser list kills the Microsoft C++ compiler. The Visual Studio 2017 version crashes when compiling `data.cpp` nce the initialiser list gets close to 80k items. The Visual Studio 2019 version didn't crash for with the full 1 million items within approx 5 minutes at which point I killed it.\n\nThere is no useful error message or documentation I co
@MarcoFalke updated, msvc is happy now, @sipsorcery thanks a lot!

> Fine with me. While we don't ship the bench binary and have no space concerns, this shouldn't hurt either.

Yes, I think this is good habit. And might  also reduce total parsing/compile time.

code review ACK 3d60a03a7cfb2d46b5f10633e9f6a9a36b8cb76f
I still can't find a way to fix it üòï
This looks like a recursive include?

```suggestion
extern const std::vector<uint8_t> block413567;
```

We generally do it without the `&`, no?
